questions.question_text: If A can complete a work in 12 days, what fraction of the work can A complete in 1 day?
questions.explanation_correct: If A can complete a work in 12 days, then A can complete 1/12 of the work in 1 day. This is because the work is divided into 12 equal parts, and A can complete one part per day.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option B (1/6) is incorrect because it represents the fraction of the work A can complete in 2 days, not 1 day. Option C (12) is incorrect because it represents the number of days A would take to complete the entire work, not the fraction of the work A can complete in 1 day. Option D (6) is incorrect because it represents the number of days it would take A to complete half the work, not the fraction of the work A can complete in 1 day.

questions.question_text: If a worker can finish a job in 15 days, how many days will it take for the same worker to complete half the job?
questions.explanation_correct: If a worker can finish a job in 15 days, it means they can complete the whole job in 15 days. Since the question asks how many days it will take to complete half the job, the answer is 7.5 days, which is half of 15 days.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer choices do not make sense in this context. Option B (15 days) is wrong because that would mean the worker takes the same time to complete half the job as the whole job, which is not logical. Option C (30 days) is wrong because that would mean the worker takes twice as long to complete half the job, which is also illogical. Option D (5 days) is wrong because that would mean the worker can complete half the job in a third of the time it takes to complete the whole job, which is unrealistic.

questions.question_text: If B can complete a piece of work in 20 days, then B's one day work is _____ of the total work.
questions.explanation_correct: If B can complete a piece of work in 20 days, then B's one day work is 1/20 of the total work. This is because if B can complete the whole work in 20 days, then B's work per day is 1/20 of the total work.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 1/20. If B can complete a piece of work in 20 days, then B's one day work is 1/20 of the total work. This is because the total work is divided into 20 equal parts, and B completes one part each day. Therefore, B's one day work is 1/20 of the total work.

questions.question_text: If a person completes 1/8 of work in one day, they will complete the entire work in 8 days.
questions.explanation_correct: If a person completes 1/8 of the work in one day, it means they will complete the entire work in 8 days. This is because 1/8 of the work is completed per day, so to complete the entire work, it will take 8 days.
questions.explanation_incorrect: If a person completes 1/8 of the work in one day, it does not mean they will complete the entire work in 8 days. This is because the work is being completed at a constant rate of 1/8 per day. To complete the entire work, it will take 8 days, as 1/8 of the work is completed each day.

questions.question_text: If A can do a work in 10 days and B can do it in 15 days, what is their combined one day's work?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is A) 1/6. This is because if A can do the work in 10 days and B can do it in 15 days, their combined rate of work is the sum of their individual rates. Therefore, their combined one day's work is 1/10 + 1/15 = 1/6.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct because they do not represent the combined one day's work of A and B. Option B) 1/10 is the rate of work for A alone, option C) 1/15 is the rate of work for B alone, and option D) 1/25 does not correctly represent the combined rate of work.

questions.question_text: A can complete a work in 18 days. After working for 6 days, what fraction of work remains?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is A) 2/3. This is because A can complete the work in 18 days. After working for 6 days, A has completed 6/18 = 1/3 of the work. Therefore, the remaining work is 2/3 of the total work.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answers are not correct because they do not represent the remaining fraction of work. For example, B) 1/3 is incorrect because A has already completed 1/3 of the work in 6 days, so the remaining work is 2/3. C) 1/2 and D) 3/4 are also incorrect as they do not accurately represent the remaining work.

questions.question_text: If two workers A and B work together, their combined work rate is the _____ of their individual work rates.
questions.explanation_correct: When two workers A and B work together, their combined work rate is the sum of their individual work rates. This is because the total amount of work done by both of them is the sum of the work done by each worker individually.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer would be 'product' of their individual work rates. This is not correct because the combined work rate is not the product of the individual work rates. The combined work rate is the sum of the individual work rates, as the total work done by the two workers together is the sum of the work done by each worker individually.

questions.question_text: A can complete a work in 12 days and B in 18 days. Working together, in how many days can they complete the work?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is A) 7.2 days. This is because when two people work together, the combined rate of work is the sum of their individual rates. So, if A can complete the work in 12 days and B can complete it in 18 days, their combined rate of work is 1/12 + 1/18 = 5/36. Therefore, they can complete the work in 36/5 = 7.2 days.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct because they do not consider the combined rate of work. B) 15 days is incorrect because it assumes the work will be completed at the slower individual rate of 18 days. C) 6 days is incorrect because it assumes the work will be completed at the faster individual rate of 12 days. D) 10 days is incorrect because it does not accurately calculate the combined rate of work.

questions.question_text: If 8 men can complete a job in 12 days, in how many days can 6 men complete the same job?
questions.explanation_correct: If 8 men can complete a job in 12 days, then in 1 day they can complete 1/12 of the job. So, 6 men can complete the same job in 16 days, as they can complete 1/16 of the job per day.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct because they do not correctly calculate the number of days it would take 6 men to complete the same job. Option B (9 days) is incorrect because it does not account for the fact that the number of workers has decreased from 8 to 6. Option C (12 days) is incorrect because it assumes that the number of workers does not change the time it takes to complete the job. Option D (18 days) is incorrect because it does not correctly calculate the rate at which the job is completed with 6 workers.

questions.question_text: In time and work problems, the number of workers and time taken are in inverse proportion.
questions.explanation_correct: In time and work problems, the number of workers and the time taken to complete the work are inversely proportional. This means that as the number of workers increases, the time taken to complete the work decreases, and vice versa. This is because more workers can complete the same amount of work in a shorter period of time.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is incorrect because in time and work problems, the number of workers and the time taken are directly proportional, not inversely proportional. This means that as the number of workers increases, the time taken to complete the work also increases, and vice versa. This is because more workers can complete the same amount of work in a shorter period of time.

questions.question_text: A and B together can complete a work in 8 days. If A alone can complete it in 12 days, in how many days can B alone complete the work?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is A) 24 days. Since A and B together can complete the work in 8 days, and A alone can complete it in 12 days, we can find the time it takes for B alone to complete the work using the formula: 1/Time(A+B) = 1/Time(A) + 1/Time(B). Solving for Time(B), we get 24 days.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answers are B) 20 days, C) 18 days, and D) 16 days. These answers do not correctly apply the formula to find the time it takes for B alone to complete the work. The correct formula is 1/Time(A+B) = 1/Time(A) + 1/Time(B), which gives us 24 days for B alone to complete the work.

questions.question_text: If 15 workers can build a wall in 10 days, how many workers are needed to build the same wall in 6 days?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is A) 25 workers. The amount of work done is inversely proportional to the number of workers and the time taken. If 15 workers can build the wall in 10 days, then 25 workers can build the same wall in 6 days.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answers are not correct because they do not follow the inverse relationship between the number of workers and the time taken. If 15 workers can build the wall in 10 days, then the number of workers required to build the same wall in 6 days should be more than 15, which is option A) 25 workers.

questions.question_text: If A can do a work in 20 days and B can do it in 30 days, working together they can complete it in _____ days.
questions.explanation_correct: If A can do the work in 20 days and B can do it in 30 days, when they work together, their combined work rate is higher. So, the time taken to complete the work together will be less than the individual times. Using the formula for combined work rate, the time taken by A and B working together is 12 days.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer would be if you thought the combined time taken by A and B is the average of their individual times, which is (20 + 30) / 2 = 25 days. However, this is not correct. When they work together, their combined work rate is higher, so the time taken is less than the average of their individual times.

questions.question_text: A pipe can fill a tank in 6 hours. What fraction of the tank does it fill in 1 hour?
questions.explanation_correct: The tank can be filled in 6 hours, so in 1 hour the pipe fills 1/6 of the tank. This is because if it takes 6 hours to fill the whole tank, then in 1 hour it will fill 1/6 of the tank.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option B '6' is incorrect because this represents the number of hours it takes to fill the tank, not the fraction of the tank filled in 1 hour. Option C '1/3' is incorrect because it is not the correct fraction for the amount of the tank filled in 1 hour. Option D '1/12' is incorrect because the pipe fills 1/6 of the tank in 1 hour, not 1/12.

questions.question_text: If an outlet pipe can empty a full tank in 8 hours, what part of the tank does it empty in 1 hour?
questions.explanation_correct: If an outlet pipe can empty a full tank in 8 hours, then it means the pipe can empty 1/8 of the tank in 1 hour. This is because if the full tank is emptied in 8 hours, then in 1 hour, the pipe can empty 1/8 of the tank.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer is 1/4. This is not correct because if the outlet pipe can empty the full tank in 8 hours, then it means it can empty 1/8 of the tank in 1 hour, not 1/4. The pipe empties 1/8 of the tank in 1 hour, not 1/4.

questions.question_text: In pipe and cistern problems, the filling pipe's work is considered positive and the emptying pipe's work is considered negative.
questions.explanation_correct: In pipe and cistern problems, the filling pipe's work is considered positive because it contributes to filling the cistern. The emptying pipe's work is considered negative because it contributes to emptying the cistern. This is the standard way of representing the work done by the pipes in these types of problems.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect explanation would be that the filling pipe's work is considered negative and the emptying pipe's work is considered positive. This is incorrect because the filling pipe's work should be considered positive, as it helps fill the cistern, while the emptying pipe's work should be considered negative, as it helps empty the cistern. The correct way to represent the work of the pipes is to consider the filling pipe's work as positive and the emptying pipe's work as negative.

questions.question_text: A pipe can fill a tank in 12 hours and another pipe can empty it in 18 hours. If both pipes are opened together, in how many hours will the tank be filled?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is A) 36 hours. This is because the first pipe can fill the tank in 12 hours, and the second pipe can empty it in 18 hours. When both pipes are opened together, the net effect is that the tank will be filled in 36 hours, which is the least common multiple of 12 and 18.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is A) 36 hours. The other options are incorrect because they do not take into account the net effect of the two pipes working together. For example, option B) 30 hours is wrong because it does not consider the fact that the second pipe can empty the tank in 18 hours, which would offset the filling rate of the first pipe.

questions.question_text: Two pipes can fill a tank in 10 hours and 15 hours respectively. If both are opened together, the tank will be full in _____ hours.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is 6 hours. This is because the first pipe can fill the tank in 10 hours, and the second pipe can fill it in 15 hours. When both pipes are opened together, the combined rate of filling is the sum of their individual rates, which is 1/10 + 1/15 = 3/30 = 1/6 of the tank per hour. Therefore, the tank will be full in 6 hours.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer would be 7.5 hours. This is because someone might think that the tank will be filled at the average rate of the two pipes, which is (1/10 + 1/15) / 2 = 1/7.5 of the tank per hour. However, this is not correct, as the rate of filling when both pipes are open is the sum of their individual rates, not the average.

questions.question_text: A can complete a work in 15 days, B in 20 days, and C in 30 days. If all three work together, in how many days will the work be completed?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is A) 7.5 days. This is because when all three people work together, the total work rate is the sum of their individual work rates. By adding the individual work rates, we can find the total work rate and then calculate the time taken to complete the work.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answers are not correct because they do not take into account the individual work rates of A, B, and C. Option B) 10 days and Option C) 12 days do not accurately represent the time taken to complete the work when all three people work together. Option D) 8 days is also incorrect, as it does not consider the individual work rates of the three people.

questions.question_text: A and B can do a piece of work in 12 days, B and C in 15 days, and C and A in 20 days. How many days will A take to do the work alone?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is A) 30 days. This can be calculated using the formula: 1/time taken together = 1/time taken by A and B + 1/time taken by B and C + 1/time taken by C and A. Plugging in the given values, we get 1/12 + 1/15 + 1/20 = 1/30, which means A alone will take 30 days to complete the work.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are incorrect because they do not correctly apply the formula to find the time taken by A alone. Option B) 24 days and Option C) 20 days do not consider all the given information, while Option D) 40 days is too high and does not match the correct calculation.

questions.question_text: If the number of workers is doubled, the time required to complete the work is also doubled.
questions.explanation_correct: If the number of workers is doubled, the time required to complete the work is not also doubled. This is because when the number of workers increases, the amount of work done per unit time also increases, so the overall time taken to complete the work will decrease, not double.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is false because the time required to complete the work is inversely proportional to the number of workers. If the number of workers is doubled, the time taken to complete the work will be halved, not doubled. This is because with more workers, the work can be done at a faster rate, leading to less overall time required.

questions.question_text: A can complete 1/4 of a work in 5 days. How many days will A take to complete the entire work?
questions.explanation_correct: Since A can complete 1/4 of the work in 5 days, it would take A 4 times that duration, or 20 days, to complete the entire work.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct because they do not correctly calculate the time it takes for A to complete the entire work. The correct answer is that it will take A 20 days to complete the entire work, as A can complete 1/4 of the work in 5 days, and therefore it will take 4 times that duration, or 20 days, to complete the entire work.

questions.question_text: A can do a work in 16 days and B in 12 days. They worked together for 4 days, then A left. B will complete the remaining work in _____ days.
questions.explanation_correct: The remaining work will be completed by B in 6 days. This is because A can do the work in 16 days, and B can do the work in 12 days. When they worked together for 4 days, they completed a part of the work. The remaining work can then be completed by B alone in 6 days.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer is 6 days. If the answer were 8 days, that would be incorrect. The reason is that when A and B worked together for 4 days, they completed a portion of the work. B can then complete the remaining work in 6 days, not 8 days.

questions.question_text: Two pipes A and B can fill a tank in 20 and 30 minutes respectively. Both pipes are opened together, but after 5 minutes, pipe A is turned off. How much more time will it take to fill the tank?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is A) 20 minutes. In 20 minutes, pipe A can fill 1/4 of the tank, and in 30 minutes, pipe B can fill 1/3 of the tank. When both pipes are opened together, they can fill the tank in 12 minutes. After 5 minutes, when pipe A is turned off, the remaining 5/6 of the tank can be filled by pipe B alone in 15 minutes, so the total time taken is 5 + 15 = 20 minutes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is A) 20 minutes. The incorrect options B) 15 minutes, C) 25 minutes, and D) 18 minutes are not correct because they do not consider the time taken after pipe A is turned off. When both pipes are opened together, they can fill the tank in 12 minutes. After 5 minutes, when pipe A is turned off, the remaining 5/6 of the tank can be filled by pipe B alone in 15 minutes, so the total time taken is 5 + 15 = 20 minutes.

questions.question_text: If A is twice as efficient as B, then A will take half the time that B takes to complete the same work.
questions.explanation_correct: If A is twice as efficient as B, it means A can complete the same work in half the time that B takes. This is because A's efficiency is double that of B's, so A will take half the time to finish the same amount of work.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is not correct. If A is twice as efficient as B, it does not mean that A will take half the time that B takes to complete the same work. This is because efficiency is a measure of how much work can be done in a given time, not the time taken to complete a fixed amount of work. A being twice as efficient as B means that A can complete the same amount of work in half the time, but it does not imply that A will take half the time that B takes.

questions.question_text: If 20 men can dig a trench in 12 days working 8 hours a day, how many days will 15 men take working 10 hours a day?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is A) 12.8 days. This is because we can calculate the amount of work done by 20 men in 12 days, and then use this to find how long 15 men will take to do the same amount of work while working 10 hours a day.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct because they do not account for the change in the number of men and the number of hours worked per day. Option B) 16 days and Option D) 15 days do not consider the increased efficiency of the 15 men working 10 hours a day, while Option C) 10 days does not take into account the smaller number of men working.

questions.question_text: A pipe fills a tank in 4 hours. Another pipe empties the full tank in 6 hours. If both pipes are open and the tank is initially empty, it will be filled in _____ hours.
questions.explanation_correct: The tank is filled in 12 hours because the first pipe takes 4 hours to fill the tank, and the second pipe takes 6 hours to empty the tank. When both pipes are open, the net rate of filling is the difference between the filling rate and the emptying rate, which results in the tank being filled in 12 hours.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is a single number, 12. If you thought the tank would be filled in a different number of hours, such as 8 or 10, that would be incorrect. The correct answer is 12 hours because the first pipe takes 4 hours to fill the tank, and the second pipe takes 6 hours to empty the tank. When both pipes are open, the net rate of filling is the difference between the two rates, resulting in the tank being filled in 12 hours.

questions.question_text: A can complete a work in 10 days. B is 25% more efficient than A. How many days will B take to complete the work?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is A) 8 days. Since B is 25% more efficient than A, it means B can complete the work 25% faster than A. If A can complete the work in 10 days, then B can complete it 25% faster, which means in 8 days.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct because: B) 12.5 days is incorrect as B is 25% more efficient than A, so B should take less time than A to complete the work. C) 7.5 days is incorrect as the work cannot be completed in less than 8 days, which is the time B takes to complete the work. D) 10 days is incorrect as B is 25% more efficient than A, so B should take less time than A to complete the work.

questions.question_text: A and B can complete a work in 20 days. If A alone can complete it in 30 days, what fraction of work can B complete in one day?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is A) 1/60. This is because if A and B together can complete the work in 20 days, and A alone can complete it in 30 days, then B alone can complete 1/30 of the work per day. Since A and B together can complete the work in 20 days, B must be completing 1/20 of the work per day. Therefore, the fraction of work B can complete in one day is 1/60.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct because they do not accurately reflect the relationship between the time taken by A and B to complete the work. Option B) 1/30 is incorrect because it assumes that B alone can complete the work in 30 days, which is not the case. Option C) 1/20 is incorrect because it assumes that B alone can complete the work in 20 days, which is also not the case. Option D) 1/10 is incorrect because it assumes that B alone can complete the work in 10 days, which is not accurate.

questions.question_text: Arrange the following workers in order of their efficiency (from most efficient to least efficient):
ordering_items: Worker who completes work in 10 days
Worker who completes work in 5 days
Worker who completes work in 15 days
Worker who completes work in 5 days
correct_answer: Worker who completes work in 5 days
Worker who completes work in 5 days
Worker who completes work in 10 days
Worker who completes work in 15 days
questions.explanation_correct: The most efficient worker is the one who completes the work in the shortest time, which is 5 days. Since there are two workers who complete the work in 5 days, they are the most efficient. The next most efficient worker is the one who completes the work in 10 days, and the least efficient worker is the one who completes the work in 15 days.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct order from most efficient to least efficient is: Worker who completes work in 5 days, Worker who completes work in 5 days, Worker who completes work in 10 days, Worker who completes work in 15 days. The reason is that the worker who completes the work in the shortest time is the most efficient, followed by the other worker who also completes the work in 5 days. The worker who completes the work in 10 days is less efficient than the 5-day workers, and the worker who completes the work in 15 days is the least efficient.

questions.question_text: What is the relationship between the number of workers and the time taken to complete a fixed amount of work?
questions.explanation_correct: The relationship between the number of workers and the time taken to complete a fixed amount of work is inverse proportion. This means that as the number of workers increases, the time taken to complete the work decreases proportionally.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct because: B) Direct proportion is not the right relationship, as the time taken decreases as the number of workers increases. C) There is a definite relationship between the number of workers and the time taken, so there is a relation. D) The relationship is not exponential, it is inverse proportion.

questions.question_text: If 12 workers complete a work in 15 days, then 18 workers will complete the same work in _____ days.
questions.explanation_correct: If 12 workers complete a work in 15 days, then the total amount of work done by the 12 workers in 15 days is fixed. Since the same work has to be completed by 18 workers, the number of days required will be less than 15 days. Using the formula 'work done = number of workers x number of days', we can calculate that 18 workers will complete the same work in 10 days.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer would be 20 days. This is because the question states that 12 workers complete the work in 15 days, so it might seem that 18 workers would complete it in a shorter time, like 10 days. However, this is not correct. The correct answer is 10 days, as the amount of work done by 12 workers in 15 days is the same as the amount of work done by 18 workers in 10 days.

questions.question_text: Three pipes A, B, and C can fill a tank in 6, 8, and 12 hours respectively. If all three are opened together, how long will it take to fill the tank?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is A) 8/3 hours. This is because the three pipes A, B, and C can fill the tank in 6, 8, and 12 hours respectively. When all three are opened together, the rate at which the tank is filled is the sum of the individual rates, which is 1/6 + 1/8 + 1/12 = 3/24 = 1/8 per hour. Therefore, the time taken to fill the tank is 1/8 per hour, or 8/3 hours.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answers are not correct because they do not consider the individual rates of the three pipes. Option B) 3 hours is wrong because the total rate of the three pipes is not 1/3 per hour. Option C) 4 hours is wrong because the total rate of the three pipes is not 1/4 per hour. Option D) 2 hours is wrong because the total rate of the three pipes is not 1/2 per hour. The correct answer is A) 8/3 hours, which is the time taken to fill the tank when all three pipes are opened together.

questions.question_text: If one pipe fills a tank in 4 hours and another empties it in 4 hours, opening both together will keep the tank level constant.
questions.explanation_correct: If one pipe fills a tank in 4 hours and another empties it in 4 hours, then opening both pipes together will keep the tank level constant. This is because the rate at which the tank is filled is equal to the rate at which it is emptied, so the water level will not change.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer would be that opening both pipes together will not keep the tank level constant. This is because the rate at which the tank is filled and emptied are equal, so the water level will remain the same. The mistake in this reasoning is that it assumes the tank level will change, when in fact it will remain constant.

questions.question_text: A can do a piece of work in 24 days. If B is 50% as efficient as A, how many days will B take to complete the work?
questions.explanation_correct: If A can complete the work in 24 days, then B, who is 50% as efficient as A, would take twice as long to complete the same work. Therefore, B would take 48 days to complete the work.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct because they do not account for the fact that B is 50% as efficient as A. If B is 50% as efficient as A, then B would take twice as long as A to complete the work. The correct answer is 48 days, not 36, 12, or 16 days.

questions.question_text: A and B together can finish a work in 12 days. A alone can finish it in 20 days. If they work together for 8 days and then A leaves, B will finish the remaining work in _____ days.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is 10 days. This is because A and B together can finish the work in 12 days, and A alone can finish it in 20 days. So, the combined work rate of A and B is 1/12 + 1/20 = 5/60 per day. After they work together for 8 days, the remaining work is (1 - 8/12) = 1/3 of the total. At the combined work rate of 5/60 per day, it will take B 10 more days to complete the remaining 1/3 of the work.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer would be something like 15 days. This is because the student may have assumed that since A and B together can finish the work in 12 days, and A alone can finish it in 20 days, then B alone can finish the remaining work in 15 days. However, this is not correct, as the combined work rate of A and B is higher than the work rate of B alone. The correct answer is 10 days, as explained in the correct explanation.

questions.question_text: A cistern can be filled by a pipe in 5 hours and emptied by an outlet in 8 hours. If both are opened simultaneously when the cistern is empty, after how many hours will it be full?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is A) 40/3 hours. This is because the rate at which the cistern is filled by the pipe is 1/5 per hour, and the rate at which it is emptied by the outlet is 1/8 per hour. When both are opened simultaneously, the net rate of filling is the difference between the two, which is 1/40 per hour. This means it will take 40/3 hours to fill the cistern completely.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct because they do not account for the fact that the cistern is being filled and emptied simultaneously. Option B) 13 hours and Option C) 10 hours do not consider the net rate of filling, which is crucial to determining the time taken to fill the cistern. Option D) 6.5 hours is incorrect because it does not correctly calculate the net rate of filling.

questions.question_text: If a man completes 3/5 of work in 9 days, how many days will he take to complete the entire work?
questions.explanation_correct: If the man completes 3/5 of the work in 9 days, then to complete the remaining 2/5 of the work, it will take him an additional 6 days. Therefore, the total time taken to complete the entire work is 9 + 6 = 15 days.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option A (15 days) is the correct answer. The other options are incorrect because they do not accurately represent the time it takes to complete the entire work. For example, Option B (12 days) is too short, as the man needs additional time to complete the remaining 2/5 of the work. Option C (18 days) is too long, as the man completes 3/5 of the work in 9 days, and the remaining 2/5 can be completed in 6 days.

questions.question_text: If two workers of equal efficiency work together, they complete the work in exactly half the time one worker would take.
questions.explanation_correct: If two workers of equal efficiency work together, they can complete the work in exactly half the time that one worker would take. This is because when two workers work together, the total amount of work done in a given time is the sum of the individual work done by each worker. Since the workers have equal efficiency, the total work done is double the work done by one worker, and therefore the time taken is halved.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is not true if the workers are not of equal efficiency. If one worker is more efficient than the other, then the work will not be completed in exactly half the time that one worker would take. The more efficient worker will do a larger share of the work, and the overall time taken will not be exactly half of what a single worker would take.

questions.question_text: Two pipes together can fill a tank in 6 hours. If one pipe takes 10 hours to fill it alone, the other pipe will take _____ hours to fill it alone.
questions.explanation_correct: The other pipe takes 15 hours to fill the tank alone because the two pipes together can fill the tank in 6 hours. Since one pipe takes 10 hours, the other pipe must take 15 hours to fill the tank alone.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer is 15 hours. If the two pipes together can fill the tank in 6 hours, and one pipe takes 10 hours, then the other pipe must take a longer time to fill the tank alone. By calculating the time it takes for the other pipe to fill the tank, we get 15 hours.

questions.question_text: A can complete a work in 18 days and B in 9 days. They worked together for 3 days and then B left. How many more days will A need to complete the remaining work?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is A) 12 days. This is because when A and B worked together for 3 days, they completed a certain amount of work. Since B left after 3 days, A needs to complete the remaining work on his own, which will take him 12 more days.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answers are not correct because they do not properly account for the work done by A and B together, and the work remaining for A to complete on his own. Option B) 9 days is incorrect because it does not consider the 3 days A and B worked together. Option C) 15 days is incorrect because it overestimates the remaining work. Option D) 6 days is incorrect because it underestimates the remaining work.

questions.question_text: If 10 men working 6 hours a day can complete a work in 12 days, in how many days can 8 men working 9 hours a day complete the same work?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is A) 10 days. This is because the work done by 10 men working 6 hours a day for 12 days is the same as the work done by 8 men working 9 hours a day for 10 days. This is calculated by considering the total amount of work done, which is the same in both cases.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is A) 10 days. The other options are incorrect because they do not correctly calculate the time taken by 8 men working 9 hours a day to complete the same work. Option B) 12 days is incorrect because it takes the same time as the original problem, which is not the case. Option C) 15 days is incorrect because it underestimates the efficiency of the 8 men working 9 hours a day. Option D) 8 days is incorrect because it overestimates the efficiency of the 8 men working 9 hours a day.

questions.question_text: Arrange the following pipes in order of their filling speed (fastest to slowest):
ordering_items: Pipe that fills tank in 3 hours
Pipe that fills tank in 3 hours
Pipe that fills tank in 9 hours
Pipe that fills tank in 6 hours
correct_answer: Pipe that fills tank in 3 hours
Pipe that fills tank in 3 hours
Pipe that fills tank in 6 hours
Pipe that fills tank in 9 hours
questions.explanation_correct: The pipes are arranged in order from fastest to slowest filling speed. The two pipes that fill the tank in 3 hours are the fastest, followed by the pipe that fills the tank in 6 hours, and the slowest is the pipe that fills the tank in 9 hours.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be to put the pipes in the order they are listed in the question, without considering the filling speed. This would be incorrect because the two pipes that fill the tank in 3 hours are the fastest, while the pipe that fills the tank in 9 hours is the slowest.

questions.question_text: A tank has two inlet pipes A and B which can fill it in 12 and 16 hours respectively, and one outlet pipe C which can empty it in 24 hours. If all three are opened together, in how many hours will the tank be filled?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is A) 9.6 hours. This is because the two inlet pipes A and B can fill the tank in 12 and 16 hours respectively, and when both are opened together, they can fill the tank faster. The outlet pipe C can empty the tank in 24 hours, so when all three pipes are opened together, the tank will be filled in 9.6 hours.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answers are not correct because they do not account for the combined effect of the two inlet pipes and the outlet pipe. B) 12 hours is too slow, as the two inlet pipes can fill the tank faster. C) 8 hours is too fast, as the outlet pipe would also be emptying the tank. D) 10 hours is also not the correct answer, as the actual time taken for the tank to be filled is 9.6 hours.

questions.question_text: A, B, and C can complete a work in 10, 12, and 15 days respectively. They started working together but C left after 2 days. The remaining work was completed by A and B in _____ more days.
questions.explanation_correct: The remaining work was completed by A and B in 4 more days because when C left after 2 days, the work done by the 3 of them in those 2 days was 2/10 + 2/12 + 2/15 = 1/5 of the total work. The remaining 4/5 of the work was then completed by A and B in 4 more days.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer is not 2 days. When C left after 2 days, the work done by the 3 of them in those 2 days was 1/5 of the total work. The remaining 4/5 of the work was then completed by A and B in 4 more days, not 2 days.

questions.question_text: If 6 workers complete a task in 10 days, then 3 workers will take 20 days to complete the same task.
questions.explanation_correct: This statement is true because when the work is divided equally among the workers, the time taken to complete the task is inversely proportional to the number of workers. If 6 workers can complete the task in 10 days, then 3 workers will take twice as long, which is 20 days, to complete the same task.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This statement is incorrect because the time taken to complete the task is not directly proportional to the number of workers. If the work is divided equally among the workers, the time taken to complete the task is inversely proportional to the number of workers. In this case, if 6 workers can complete the task in 10 days, then 3 workers will take 20 days to complete the same task, not 10 days.

questions.question_text: Two pipes can fill a tank in 15 and 20 hours. A drain pipe can empty the full tank in 30 hours. With all three pipes open, how long will it take to fill the empty tank?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is A) 12 hours. This is because when all three pipes (two filling and one draining) are open, the tank will be filled in 12 hours. The two filling pipes together can fill the tank in 10 hours, and the draining pipe can empty the tank in 30 hours. By combining these rates, we can calculate the net time taken to fill the tank as 12 hours.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answers are not correct because they do not account for the combination of the filling and draining pipes. Option B) 10 hours is incorrect because it only considers the time taken by the two filling pipes, without considering the draining pipe. Options C) 15 hours and D) 18 hours are also incorrect because they do not correctly calculate the net time taken to fill the tank when all three pipes are open.

questions.question_text: A and B together can complete a work in 16 days. If A's efficiency is 3 times that of B, in how many days can B alone complete the work?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is A) 64 days. Since A's efficiency is 3 times that of B, B alone will take 3 times longer to complete the work. If A and B together can complete the work in 16 days, then B alone will take 3 times longer, which is 48 days.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answers are B) 48 days, C) 32 days, and D) 24 days. These answers do not consider the fact that A's efficiency is 3 times that of B. Since B alone will take 3 times longer to complete the work, the correct answer is A) 64 days.

questions.question_text: What is the value of 1/10 work per day?
questions.explanation_correct: If 1/10 of the work is done per day, then to complete the entire work, it would take 10 days. Therefore, the value of 1/10 work per day is 10 days.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The value of 1/10 work per day is not 15 days, 20 days, or 5 days. This is because if 1/10 of the work is done per day, then the entire work will be completed in 10 days. Therefore, the correct answer is 10 days.

questions.question_text: What is the value of 1/5 work per day?
questions.explanation_correct: If 1/5 work is done per day, then the total work will be completed in 5 days. This is because 1/5 work per day means that it will take 5 days to complete the entire work.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option A is incorrect because 15 days would be the time taken to complete the entire work, not just 1/5 of the work. Option C is incorrect because 20 days would be the time taken to complete the entire work, not just 1/5 of the work. Option D is incorrect because 10 days would be the time taken to complete the entire work, not just 1/5 of the work.

questions.question_text: What is the value of 1/20 work per day?
questions.explanation_correct: The value of 1/20 work per day is 20 days. This is because if a person completes 1/20 of the work in a day, it will take them 20 days to complete the entire work.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The value of 1/20 work per day is not 15 days, 10 days, or 5 days. These options are incorrect because they do not accurately represent the time it takes to complete the entire work if a person does 1/20 of the work per day. The correct answer is 20 days, as it takes 20 days to complete the entire work if a person does 1/20 of the work per day.

questions.question_text: What is the value of 1/15 work per day?
questions.explanation_correct: The value of 1/15 work per day means that the person can complete 1/15 of the total work in one day. This means that to complete the entire work, it will take 15 days, which is the correct answer (A).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answers are not correct because they do not represent the time it takes to complete the entire work. For example, 5 days (B) would mean the person can complete 1/5 of the work per day, which is not the same as 1/15 work per day. Similarly, 10 days (C) and 20 days (D) do not match the given information of 1/15 work per day.

questions.question_text: What time does A (12 days) + B (12 days) show?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is B) 6 days. When A takes 12 days and B takes 12 days to complete a task, the total time taken is the sum of their individual times, which is 12 + 12 = 24 days. Therefore, the total time taken is 24 days, which is equal to 6 weeks or 6 days.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer A) 10 days is not correct. If A takes 12 days and B takes 12 days to complete a task, the total time taken is the sum of their individual times, which is 12 + 12 = 24 days. Therefore, the total time taken is 24 days, which is equal to 6 weeks or 6 days, not 10 days.

questions.question_text: What time does C (10 days) + D (15 days) show?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is A) 6 days. When two workers C and D work together, their combined work efficiency is the sum of their individual work efficiencies. So, the total time taken by C and D together is the sum of their individual work times, which is 10 days + 15 days = 25 days. The time taken by both workers together is 25 days, which is 6 days less than the time taken by C alone (10 days).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer B) 10 days is not correct because when two workers C and D work together, their combined work efficiency is the sum of their individual work efficiencies. The total time taken by C and D together is the sum of their individual work times, which is 10 days + 15 days = 25 days, not 10 days.

questions.question_text: What time does E (8 days) + F (24 days) show?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is A) 6 days. When two people E and F work together, the total work done is the sum of their individual work rates. E completes the work in 8 days, while F completes the work in 24 days. Together, they can complete the work in 6 days, which is the correct answer.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer B) 10 days is not correct. When two people work together, the total work done is the sum of their individual work rates. The time taken to complete the work is inversely proportional to the sum of their work rates. In this case, E completes the work in 8 days, while F completes the work in 24 days. Together, they can complete the work in 6 days, not 10 days.

questions.question_text: What time does G (20 days) + H (20 days) show?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is A) 10 days. When G takes 20 days and H takes 20 days, the total work done by both of them is equivalent to the work done by one person in 10 days, as the work is divided equally between them.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer is B) 6 days. This is not correct because when two people work together, the total work done is the same as the work done by one person in half the time. So, if G and H each take 20 days to complete the work, the total time taken by both of them together is 10 days, not 6 days.
